message.subject: Max Holmes Deposition-Day No. 1
message.content:
M1.1. Richard:
[Conventional: salutation]
M1.2. It was another great deposition day for the plaintiffs.
[Inform: today was a great deposition day for plaintiffs]
M1.3. The high point was
an audio taped phone conversation of Max Holmes' calling Stickler a liar.
[Inform: best part was an taped phone conversation of Max Holmes calling Stickler a liar]
M1.4. A
more detailed report is attached.
[Inform: more detailed report attached]
M1.5. Frankly, I don't think McDonald and NatWest can let this case go to trial.
[Inform: Steve doesn't think McDonald and NatWest can let this case go to trial]
M1.6. They will almost surely lose, and lose big, and PaineWebber could be drawn in
too.
[Inform: these two will almost surely lose big, and PaineWebber could be drawn in as well]
M1.7. I think I will make a renewed pitch to Bruce MacLeod (Farallon's lawyer
here this week) to let ECT out.
[Inform: Steve plans to once again ask Farallon's lawyer, Bruce MacLeod, to let ECT out]
M1.8. I will keep you posted.
[Inform: Steve will keep Richard posted]
M1.9. Steve
[Conventional: signature]

message.subject: Max Holmes Deposition-Day No. 1
message.content:
M2.1. Please review and let me know if you have any comments.
[Request-Action: review and give any comments]
Flink2.1
